title: Conservation of angular momentum - carts on rod

content.question: A system consists of two identical carts that can slide along a rod of negligible mass. The system rotates with negligible friction about an axle at the center of the rod. Initially, each cart is fixed halfway between the axle and the end of the rod and the system rotates with angular speed <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, as shown in the top view. While rotating, the carts are released and slide to the ends of the rod. Which of the following correctly relates the final angular speed <math alttext="omega sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> to <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="omega sub f equals omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="omega sub f equals the fraction omega sub 0 over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="omega sub f equals the fraction omega sub 0 over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="omega sub f equals the fraction omega sub 0 over 16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>16</mn></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="omega sub f equals the fraction omega sub 0 over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems
